title: Edgar Allan Poe

Countering them, however, are such critics as James Schroeter and John Lauber, who call for a "literal" reading of the text as Poe's attempt to achieve a unified Gothic effect. That is, his supernaturalism is to be taken, with appropriate suspensions of disbelief, at face value. A key argument offered by the literalists is that Poe altered his text at Philip Cooke's suggestion to increase verisimilitude
